questions.question: You may come …………………………… you want.
questions.description: Whenever is used to mean that it does not matter when.

questions.question: …………………………. I was not there, I could not meet him.
questions.description: We use as to introduce the reason for something.

questions.question: She was late ………………………………. she could not watch the program.
questions.description: We use so to indicate the result or effect or the action mentioned in the previous clause.

questions.question: ……………………………. you broke the law you shall be punished.
questions.description: We use because to indicate the reason for something.

questions.question: He won the match …………………………. his injuries.
questions.description: Before a noun we use a preposition.

questions.question: ……………………………… he was suffering from injuries, he won the match.
questions.description: We use although to connect two contrasting ideas. Note that it is a conjunction and hence it is followed by a clause.

questions.question: He advanced …………………………….. he could.
questions.description: As far is used to indicate distance.

questions.question: I waited for him ………………………….. 10 o’clock.
questions.description: Until is used to indicate time.

questions.question: …………………………… you have apologized, we will not take any further actions against you.
questions.description: We use since to introduce the reason for something.

questions.question: …………………………….. I was younger, I could run faster.
It was so dark ……………………………… I could not see anything.
questions.description: The conjunction so..that is used to indicate cause and effect.
